Summary
functions.phpContain all the functions used in Simple Invoices
Functions
get_custom_field_labelPrints the name of the custom field based on the input.
getCustomFieldLabelsUsed to get the names of the custom fields.
get_custom_field_nameUsed by manage_custom_fields to get the name of the custom field and which section it relates to (ie, biller/product/customer)
do_trPrint a new table row “</tr><tr>” depending on the input, used in printing the custom fields and phone numbers section of the invoice
merge_addressMerges the city, state, and zip info onto one live and takes into account the commas
print_if_not_nullUsed in the print preview to determine if a row/field gets printed, basically if the field is null dont print it else do
inv_itemised_cfPrints the custom fields for the product in an itemised invoice
calc_invoice_taxCalculates the total tax for a given invoices
show_custom_field

Functions

get_custom_field_label

function get_custom_field_label($field)

Prints the name of the custom field based on the input.  If the custom field has not been defined by the user than use the default in the lang files

Arguments

fieldThe custom field in question

getCustomFieldLabels

function getCustomFieldLabels($type)

Used to get the names of the custom fields.  If custom fields is blank in db then print ‘Custom Field’ and the ID Arguments: Type - is the module your getting the labels of the custom fields for, ie. biller

get_custom_field_name

function get_custom_field_name($field)

Used by manage_custom_fields to get the name of the custom field and which section it relates to (ie, biller/product/customer)

Arguments

fieldThe custom field in question

do_tr

function do_tr($number,
$class)

Print a new table row “</tr><tr>” depending on the input, used in printing the custom fields and phone numbers section of the invoice

Arguments

numberused to count which item the codes upto and depending print the trs
classthe css class for the tr

merge_address

function merge_address($field1,
$field2,
$field3,
$street1,
$street2,
$class1,
$class2,
$colspan)

Merges the city, state, and zip info onto one live and takes into account the commas

Arguments

field1normally city
field2noramlly state
field3normally zip
street1street 1 added print the word “Address:” on the first line of the invoice
street2street 2 added print the word “Address:” on the first line of the invoice
class1the css class for the first td
class2the css class for the second td
colspanthe td colspan of the last td

print_if_not_null

function print_if_not_null($label,
$field,
$class1,
$class2,
$colspan)

Used in the print preview to determine if a row/field gets printed, basically if the field is null dont print it else do

Arguments

labelThe name of the field, ie.  Custom Field 1, Email, etc..
fieldThe actual value from the db ie, te.nosp@m.st@test.nosp@m..com for email etc...
class1the css class of the first td
class2the css class of the second td
colspanthe colspan of the last td

inv_itemised_cf

function inv_itemised_cf($label,
$field)

Prints the custom fields for the product in an itemised invoice

Arguments

labelThe name of the field, ie.  Custom Field 1, etc..
fieldThe actual value from the db ie, ABN-12-34-66 etc...

calc_invoice_tax

function calc_invoice_tax($master_invoice_id)

Calculates the total tax for a given invoices

Arguments

invoice_idThe name of the field, ie.  Custom Field 1, etc..

show_custom_field

function show_custom_field($custom_field,
$custom_field_value,
$permission,
$css_class_tr,
$css_class1,
$css_class2,
$td_col_span,
$seperator)
If a custom field has been defined then show it in the add,edit, or view invoice screenThis is used for the Invoice Custom Fields - may be used for the others as wll based on the situation

Parameters

custom_fieldthe db name of the custom field ie invoice_cf1
custom_field_valuethe value of this custom field for a given invoice
permissionthe permission level - ie. in a print view its gets a read level, in an edit or add screen its write leve
css_class_trthe css class the the table row (tr)
css_class1the css class of the first td
css_class2the css class of the second td
td_col_spanthe column span of the right td
seperatorused in the print view ie. adding a : between the 2 values

Returns

Depending on the permission passed, either a formatted input box and the label of the custom field or a table row and data
